data.title: Quick Campus Comparison
data.meta_description: Here is a quick comparison of twenty of the campuses you will find located in Durham County, Orange County and Wake County -- all within just about 20 miles of each other!
data.meta_site_name: Triangle Campus Guide | For College-Bound Visitors Touring Raleigh, Durham & Chapel Hill
data.text:
The Triangle area of North Carolina is home to many colleges and universities that offer outstanding and unique educational opportunities. Here is a quick comparison of twenty of the campuses you will find located in Durham County, Orange County and Wake County — all within just about 20 miles of each other!

Duke University

Location: 2138 Campus Drive, Durham, North CarolinaOverview: Younger than most other prestigious U.S. research universities, Duke University consistently ranks among the very best. Duke’s graduate and professional schools — in business, divinity, engineering, the environment, law, medicine, nursing and public policy — are among the leaders in their fields.

Size: 6,485 Undergraduates and 8,465 Graduate and Professional students

Academics: Duke University offers 53 majors, 52 minors and 23 certificates, and also offers undergraduate students the opportunity to create their own degree programs.

Athletics: NCAA Division 1, ACC Conference, Blue Devils

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes – Over 200 Programs

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 49% Female, 51% Male; 46% Caucasian/White, 22% Asian/Asian American, 10% Black/African American, 7% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 14% Unknown

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: www.admissions.duke.edu

University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill

Location: 250 East Franklin St, Chapel Hill, NC

Overview: Carolina opened its doors for students in 1795 as the nation’s first public university. Situated in the beautiful college town of Chapel Hill, N.C., UNC has earned a reputation as one of the best universities in the world.

Size: 18,415 Undergraduates, 10,669 Graduates

Academics: More than 70 majors and minors within 60 departments. Known for strengths in liberal arts, journalism, business, and pre-medicine.

Athletics: NCAA Division 1, ACC Conference, Tar Heels

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes – 325 Programs in 70 Countries

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 60% Female, 40% Male. 34% Caucasian/White, 14% Asian/Asian American, 11% Black/African American, 7% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 2% Native American, 0.1% Pacific Islander

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: www.unc.edu/visitors

North Carolina State University

Location: 1210 Varsity Dr, Raleigh, NC 27695

Overview: North Carolina State University is a large, comprehensive university known for its leadership in education and research and is globally recognized for science, technology, engineering and mathematics.

Size: 25,199 Undergraduates, 10,280 Graduates

Academics: Nearly 100 majors and more than 120 minors and more than 160 master’s programs and more than 60 doctoral programs.

Athletics: NCAA Division 1, ACC Conference, Wolfpack

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 47% Female, 53% Male. 73% Caucasian/White, 6% Black/African American, 5% Asian/Asian American, 5% Hispanic/Latino/Latina

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://admissions.ncsu.edu/visit/schedule-your-visit/

Other Campuses: Durham County | Orange County | Wake County

Durham County Campuses

North Carolina Central University

Location: 1801 Fayetteville St, Durham, NC 27707Overview: Founded in 1910, North Carolina Central University was the first publicly supported liberal arts college for African-Americans. Consistently ranked as a top Historically Black College or University and regional university in the south, NCCU offers flagship programs in the sciences, education, law, business, nursing and the arts. With both a biomanufacturing and a biomedical research institute, NCCU is emerging as a leader in the study of health disparities. We offer hands-on laboratory experience in collaboration with pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies based in Research Triangle Park and elsewhere across the state.

Size: 8,078 Total Students; 6,067 undergraduate students; 1,608 graduate students

Academics: 78 majors offered with 146 areas including concentrations. Bachelor’s: 37, Master’s/First Professional: 39, Certificates: 1, Doctoral: 1

Athletics: NCAA Division I, MEAC (Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference), Eagles

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 71.6% African-American, 9.7% White, 6.6% Hispanic; 1.3% Asian

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://www.nccu.edu/we-are-nc-central

Durham Technical Community College

Location: 1637 East Lawson Street, Durham, NC 27703

Overview: A comprehensive community college serving Durham and Orange counties, Durham Tech offers postsecondary technical and occupational programs leading to a degree, diploma, or certificate; the first two years of a four-year degree; general continuing education for personal growth; and college and career readiness instruction.Size (all Durham Tech campuses): 7,188 curriculum, 8,493 continuing education

Academics: Focus on Career Technologies Health Technologies, Arts, Sciences, and University Transfer

Athletics: N/A

On-Campus Housing: N/A

Graduate School: N/A

Study Abroad: N/A

Greek System: N/A

Demographics (All Durham Tech Campuses): 61% Female, 39% Male; 39% Black/African American, 33% Caucasian/White, 16% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 12% Other

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: www.durhamtech.edu/admissions/campustours.htm

Apex School of Theology

Location: 1701 T.W. Alexander Drive, Durham, North Carolina 27703Overview: The ASOT provides theological education to prepare clergy and laity for service in churches, Christian ministries and the community. The institution’s history is grounded in the African-American religious experience.

Size: 492 students

Academics: Christian Education, Theology, Christian Counseling, and Master’s/Doctor of Divinity

Athletics: N/A

On-Campus Housing: N/A

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: N/A

Greek System: N/A

Work/Study Programs: N/A

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://apexsot.edu

University of Mount Olive – RTP Campus

Location: 5001 S. Miami Blvd., Durham NC 27703Overview: A satellite campus of the University of Mount Olive in Mount Olive, NC, founded by the Convention of Free Will Baptists. Offers flexible, accelerated one-evening-per-week degree programs for adults as well as online classes.

Academics: Accredited degree programs in Accounting, Business Management, Criminal Justice, Early Childhood Education, Recreation and Leisure Studies, and Leadership, among others.

Athletics: NCAA Division II

On-Campus Housing: N/A at this location

Graduate School: N/A at this location

Study Abroad: N/A at this location

Greek System: N/A at this location

Demographics: 67% female, 33% male

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://www.umo.edu/rtp

Watts School of Nursing

Location: 2828 Croasdaile Dr #200, Durham, NC 27705Overview: Since its inception in 1895, Watts has focused exclusively on nursing education for entry into professional nursing practice, and is the oldest nursing program for registered nurses in the state of North Carolina. Watts is also the only hospital-based diploma program in the state.

Academics: Nursing

Athletics: N/A

On-Campus Housing: N/A

Graduate School: N/A

Study Abroad: N/A

Greek System: N/A

Demographics: Watts averages approximately 150 students. For the 2015-2016 academic year, 19% of the student body belonged to minority ethnic groups and 12% male.

Work/Study Programs: N/A

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://wattsschoolofnursing.org

Orange County Campuses

Durham Tech in Orange County

Location: 525 College Park Road, Hillsborough, NC 27278

Overview: The Orange County Campus (OCC) at Durham Tech is a 20-acre campus centrally located in Orange County. The purpose of the campus is to better serve Orange County residents as they pursue their education, workforce training, and lifelong learning goals.

Size (All Durham Tech Campuses): 7,637 Curriculum, 12,515 Continuing Education

Academics: Focus on Career Technologies, Health Technologies, Arts, Sciences, and University Transfers

Athletics: None

On-Campus Housing: No

Graduate School: No

Study Abroad: No

Greek System: No

Demographics (All Durham Tech Campuses): 61% Female, 39% Male; 39% Black/African American, 33% Caucasian/White, 16% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 12% Other

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: www.durhamtech.edu/orange/orangecountycampus.htm

Wake County Colleges & Universities

Campbell Law School

Location: 225 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27603

Overview: Campbell Law is one of the smallest ABA-accredited private law schools in the country. With a limited first-year enrollment, students enjoy the many advantages of a law school that remains purposely small. The size enables students to build a network of relationships that extends far beyond graduation.

Size: 497 Graduates

Academics: Three-year Juris Doctor program, with nine practice areas, six dual-degree programs and three certificate programs.

Athletics: No

On-Campus Housing: No

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: No

Greek System: No

Demographics: 46% Female, 54% Male.

Work/Study Programs: No

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://law.campbell.edu

Meredith College

Location: 3800 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27607

Overview: Chartered in 1891, Meredith College is one of the largest private women’s colleges in the United States, with coeducational programs at the graduate level. Nationally ranked as a top-tier liberal arts college, Meredith challenges students to explore their interests, expand their skills, and build on their strengths.

Size: 1,603 Undergraduates, 302 Graduates

Academics: More than 80 majors, minors and concentrations; 16 graduate and certificate programs.

Athletics: NCAA Division III, USA South Athletic Conference, Avenging Angels

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: No

Demographics: Undergraduates 100% Female. 71% Caucasian/White, 11% Black/African American, 3% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 3% Asian/Asian American

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://www.meredith.edu/admissions/visit

Saint Augustine’s University

Location: 1315 Oakwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27610

Overview: Established in 1867 by The Episcopal Diocese of North Carolina, Saint Augustine’s University is a four-year liberal arts university with a mission to sustain a learning community in which students can prepare academically, socially and spiritually for leadership in a complex, diverse and rapidly changing world.

Size: 767 Undergraduates

Academics: More than 20 undergraduate degree programs within four major academic schools, and an extended studies program for working adults.

Athletics: NCAA Division II, Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association, Falcons

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: No

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 49% Female, 51% Male. 96% Black/African-American, 1.1% Caucasian/White

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://admissions.st-aug.edu/schedule-a-visit.html

Shaw University

Location: 118 E South St, Raleigh, NC 27601

Overview: Shaw University, the first historically black university in the southern United States, is a private liberal arts institution affiliated with the Baptist Church with a rich history steeped in tradition, activism and service.

Size: 1,305 Undergraduates, 106 Graduates

Academics: More than 20 undergraduate programs and 10 graduate programs.

Athletics: NCAA Division II, Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association, Bears

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: Yes

Demographics: 58% Female, 42% Male. 62% Black/African American, 38% Other Race/Unspecified

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://www.shawu.edu/campustour/

Shepherds Theological Seminary

Location: 6051 Tryon Rd, Cary, NC 27518

Overview: Shepherds Theological Seminary is committed to theologically conservative academic excellence and exists to impact the world for Christ by equipping servant leaders for life and ministry by strategically shaping both intellect and character through biblical scholarship and personal mentoring.

Size: 100 students

Academics: Four masters programs, one doctoral program and three nontraditional diploma programs.

Athletics: No

On-Campus Housing: No

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: Yes, Israel Initiative

Greek System: No

Demographics: N/A

Work/Study Programs: No

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://shepherds.edu

Southeastern Baptist Theological Seminary (and The College at Southeastern)

Location: 120 S Wingate St, Wake Forest, NC 27587

Overview: Southeastern Baptist Theological Seminary is a seminary of the Southern Baptist Convention (SBC) created to meet a need in the SBC’s East Coast region. This private seminary combines the best of a liberal arts college education with substantial biblical and theological training.

Size: 4,700 students

Academics: 40 different programs including Associate, Bachelor’s, Master’s and Doctoral Research programs.

Athletics: No

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: Yes

Study Abroad: No

Greek System: No

Demographics: 20% Female, 80% Male. 81% Caucasian/White, 6% Hispanic/Latino/Latina 4% Black/African American, 3% Asian/Pacific Islander

Work/Study Programs: No

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://www.sebts.edu

Southeastern Free Will Baptist College

Location: 532 Eagle Rock Rd, Wendell, NC 27591

Overview: A college of the Free Will Baptist denomination with a purpose to train and prepare students for church-related ministries. Southeastern Free Will Baptist’s mission as a Christian College is to help students find their place in God’s great field of service.

Size: 55 students

Academics: Four bachelor degree programs (Bible, Christian Education, Religious Arts and Church Music), a three year degree program in Biblical Studies and a non-degree two year business program.

Athletics: No

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: No

Study Abroad: No

Greek System: No

Demographics: N/A

Work/Study Programs: No

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: https://www.sfwbc.edu/visit

Wake Technical Community College

Location: 9101 Fayetteville Rd, Raleigh, NC 27603

Overview: N.C.’s largest community college. Wake Tech is an accredited, two year community college offering associates degrees, technical certification and non-credit courses.

Size: 74,000 students annually; approximately 30,000 in curriculum programs and 4,000 in workforce continuing education

Academics: More than 200 curriculum programs – associate degree, diploma and certificate programs.

Athletics: National Junior College Athletics Association, Division II, Region 10, Eagles

On-Campus Housing: No

Graduate School: No

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: No

Demographics: 56% Female, 44% Male. 51% Caucasian/White, 27% Black/African American, 10% Hispanic/Latino/Latina, 5% Asian/Pacific Islander

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://www.waketech.edu

William Peace University

Location: 15 E Peace St, Raleigh, NC 27604

Overview: Founded in 1857, William Peace University is a private, nationally ranked, award-winning educational institution that is located in downtown Raleigh. Rooted in the liberal arts tradition, students develop an appreciation for life-long learning, a focus on meaningful careers and skills for ethical citizenship.

Size: 800+ students

Academics: More than 30 majors, minors and concentrations.

Athletics: NCAA Division III, USA South Athletic Conference, Pacers

On-Campus Housing: Yes

Graduate School: No

Study Abroad: Yes

Greek System: No

Demographics: 54% Female, 46% Male. 53% Caucasian/White, 24% Black, 2% Unknown, 12% Hispanic/Latino, 5% two or more races, 2% Asian/Asian American

Work/Study Programs: Yes

Financial Aid: Yes

Website Link: http://www.peace.edu/admissions-aid/plan-a-visit/
